description.narrative: For With the funds, the Red Nacional de Ecoclubes (National Network of Ecoclubs) will support youth leadership in ecological issues and raise awareness about innovative and restorative natural resource management techniques. Neighborhoods and communities in extreme poverty are often without technical assistance and using outdated, unsustainable practices that focus heavily on agrochemicals. Natural resources and services, including carbon storage and water, are being degraded and issues like illegal logging are on the rise. The group will work with partnering schools to develop workshops that promote the restoration of natural resources, and will focus on bio construction and traditional techniques that are inexpensive and comfortable. It will focus on practices that promote and restore soil health in food production, particularly for agricultural, horticultural, and ranching lands. The project will work with 25 youth, of whom 13 are young women and 12 are young men.
